Replace.Text: Activate Historical Spawn Dates or Eras
Disable to turn off all HSD features and gameplay changes. Use this option to disable the mod without changing your active mods.
Players appear during the transition to a new Era. Overrides the Timeline setting to use the HistoricalSpawnEras table instead.
Disabling this option is NOT RECOMMENDED. Disable to turn off all bonuses and spawn zones for new players.
Techs and Civics that would receive a eureka boost are completed. New Civs will be more advanced with this option enabled.
Receive a burst of Great Person points towards all Great People when spawning (adjusted for Game Speed)
Unique units will be included in the starting units
All Civs with HSD receive an Era Building in every city which boosts yields (if false, only Colonial Civs will receive Era Buildings)
Activate dynamic colony generation for European Civs
Colonization mode will include the human player (only affects AI players if disabled)
Cities in the Spawn Zone will not revolt. New players can still Declare War if the Spawn Zone is occupied.
If a Spawn Zone is occupied and a new starting plot is chosen, the Spawn Zone will be moved to the new location.
Era Score is earned from Turn 1 for players waiting to spawn. If this option is disabled Era Score is earned after the first Civilization enters the Classical Era.
Starting units for new players will be one Era behind the most advanced player's Era. If this option is disabled starting units are equal to the most advanced player's Era.

HSD only affects Isolated Civilizations and Colonial Civilizations, as well as their related City-States. All other Civilizations and City-States start the game normally. Overrides the Timeline setting. Compatible with Spawn by Era mode.

Convert cities in the spawn zone to the new player. Always converts the capital if the starting plot is owned by another player. Surrounding cities are converted if they would be converted to a free city (must not be an original capital, the owner's last city, or contain an established Governor)
Attempts to convert all cities within the spawn range. Skips the governor check.
Coastal cities owned by players with a Harbor or unique replacement will always remain loyal
Gran Colombia Comandante unique units will spawn in the Industrial Era (all previous Era units will spawn at once)
Based on a mixture of historical realism and gameplay balance
Based on the national founding dates for countries

Set the range of plots surrounding a starting plot that will be searched for a new city if the spawn zone is occupied.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If a new city cannot be built within this range, the new player will spawn on the nearest unoccupied plot to the starting plot by default.
All Civilizations use Historical Spawn Dates
Only Colonial and Isolated Civs use Historical Spawn Dates
